info.name: Dimona API ‚Äì Production & Fulfillment
info.description:
Welcome to the Dimona API ‚Äî your gateway to fast, high-quality direct-to-garment (DTG) printing across the Americas.

Dimona operates the largest on-demand DTG network in Latin America, with facilities in the U.S., Brazil, Mexico, Argentina, and Chile. Whether you're building an eCommerce store, managing a B2B merch program, or scaling global fulfillment ‚Äî this API gets your orders printed, packed, and shipped with precision.

**Key Features:**

- üì¶ Local production, faster delivery
    
- üßµ High-quality DTG printing (no minimums)
    
- üåç International reach with region-optimized logistics
    

Explore the endpoints below to submit orders, check inventory, track production events, and manage your fulfillment workflow.

request.description:
## üßæ Submit a Production Order

Create a new DTG production order to be printed, packed, and shipped from one of our regional facilities.

Use this endpoint to send print-ready artwork, shipping details, and item metadata. Orders are automatically validated, assigned to the best facility, and queued for fulfillment.

### üîß Required Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `id` | string | Your unique order reference (used for idempotency) |
| `items` | array | List of products to print, each with a valid SKU and quantity |
| `print_files` | object | High-res artwork for each print location (PNG, 300 DPI, transparent) |
| `preview_files` | object | Customer-facing mockups. |
| `address_to` | object | Shipping details for the end customer |
| `shipping` | object | Carrier and shipping priority |

### ü™õ Optional Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `sample` | boolean | Mark order as a sample or test (bypasses normal flow) |
| `reprint` | boolean | Reprint of a previously failed/damaged order |
| `xqc` | boolean | Enable extra quality control for high-value orders |
| `package_inserts` | array | Marketing materials (PDFs, 4x6 recommended) |
| `packing_slip` | string | Custom PDF packing slip (letter size, optional) |

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Best Practices

1. **Check inventory** for each SKU before submitting.
    
2. **Use unique order IDs** to avoid duplicates.
    
3. **Validate print files** (300 DPI, correct format) to avoid quality issues.
    
4. **Include customer contact** for delivery updates and return handling.

## üì¶ Retrieve a Production Order

Get full details of a submitted production order using its `reference_id`.

This endpoint returns the order‚Äôs current status, shipping details, item list and  
tracking info (if shipped).

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Notes

- Order-level status does not reflect per-item events ‚Äî for a detailed timeline, use `GET /order/{id}/events`.
    

### üîç Use Cases

- Track order progress in real-time
    
- Display shipping status and tracking to customers
    

### üìã Order Status Values

| Status | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `Pending` | Order received |
| `In Production` | Items are currently being printed/manufactured |
| `Shipped` | Order dispatched with tracking |
| `Cancelled` | Order was cancelled |

### üîÑ Common Status Flows

- **Standard:** `Pending` ‚Üí `In Production` ‚Üí `Shipped`
    
- **Cancelled:** Any status ‚Üí `Cancelled` (restrictions apply)
    

### üßæ Response Includes

- `id`, `reference_id`
    
- Full address info (`address_to`, `address_from`)
    
- `status`, `created_at`, `updated_at`
    
- All `items` with print files and status
    
- `tracking_number`

response.name: Retrieve a production order
response.body:
{
    "id": "spfy_5_12341234",
    "reference_id": "1234e5a1-1234-1234-1234-f3f9a4ccf8c9",

    },

    },

        {
            "id": "12806896812172",

            },

            },

    "tracking_number": "9400.....",
    "carrier": "USPS"
}

request.description:
## ‚ùå Cancel Production Order

Cancel an order before it enters production or shipping.

This endpoint allows full or partial cancellation of production orders, depending on their current status. You can cancel the entire order or specific items, and optionally provide a reason and notes for better traceability.

### üïí When Cancellation Is Allowed

- ‚úÖ `Pending`: Always cancellable
    
- ‚ùå `In Production`, `Shipped`: Not cancellable via API (contact support)
    
    - Orders in In Production status may still be cancellable if all SKUs meet specific eligibility criteria.
        
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Special Cases: Samples and reprints may follow different rules
    

### üõ† Partial Cancellations

You can cancel individual items within the order by passing an array of item IDs. The rest of the order continues through the normal flow.

## üìú Retrieve Order Events

Fetch a detailed timeline of all production-related events for a given order.

Unlike the main order status (which reflects the order as a whole), this endpoint returns **granular item-level actions**, including printing, packaging, and shipping steps ‚Äî with timestamps and affected item IDs.

### üìö Use Cases

- Visualize step-by-step progress of an order
    
- Build a production dashboard or internal tracking UI
    
- Debug production delays or errors
    
- Generate audit logs or reporting based on actual timestamps
    

### üßæ Event Format

Each event contains:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `time` | string | ISO 8601 timestamp when the event occurred |
| `action` | string | Type of event (e.g. `created`, `picked`, `printed`, `packaged`, `shipped`) |
| `affected_items` | string\[\] | Array of item IDs affected by this action |
| `tracking_number` | string | (Only on `shipped`) The tracking number assigned |
| `carrier` | string | (Only on `shipped`) The carrier used for fulfillment |

request.description:
## üóÇÔ∏è Submit a Production Order ‚Äì Legacy Payload

Legacy version of the production order submission endpoint, maintained for backward compatibility with older Brazil-based integrations.

Use this only if you‚Äôre still using the legacy structure from `/api/v3/orders`. All new integrations should use the standard `/api/v2021/orders` format.

### üß≠ Purpose

This endpoint allows systems using the Brazil API format to continue working without immediate migration. Fields are mapped internally to the current standard format.

### üìö Use Cases

- Existing Shopify apps or marketplaces integrated before 2021
    
- Gradual migration of legacy systems to new API structure
    
- Internal tooling still using old payload shape
    

### üîÑ Key Field Mappings

| Legacy Field | Mapped To |
| --- | --- |
| `order_id` | `id` |
| `customer_name` | `address_to.first_name` + `last_name` |
| `customer_email` | `address_to.email` |
| `qty` | `quantity` |
| `designs` | `print_files` |
| `mocks` | `preview_files` |
| `address.street` + `number` | `address_to.address1` |
| `zipcode` | `address_to.zip` |

### ‚ùå Ignored Fields (Brazil-specific)

- `customer_document`: Not used in U.S. operations
    
- `nfe`: Tax invoice for Brazil, ignored elsewhere
    
- `address.neighborhood`: Not part of U.S. addressing format
    

### üåé Regional Behavior

- **Brazil Orders**: Brazil-specific fields (e.g. `nfe`, `customer_document`) are processed
    
- **US/International**: Those fields are ignored gracefully; U.S. rules applied
    

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecation Notice

This endpoint will continue to function but is **deprecated**. Please plan to:

1. Update your payloads to match the `/v2021/orders` format
    
2. Use field names compatible with the current schema
    
3. Remove reliance on this endpoint within 12 months

response.name: Submit a production order - with legacy payload - success

request.description:
## üßæ Get Stocks

Retrieve a **paginated list** of available SKUs, including stock levels, product specs, and print capabilities.

Use this endpoint to **browse** or **sync** your product catalog page by page. It‚Äôs optimized for frontend catalog rendering, collection pages, and syncing stock availability for larger datasets.

### üßæ Query Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `limit` | integer | Optional | Number of items per page (default: 50, max: 100) |
| `offset` | integer | Optional | Offset index for pagination (e.g., 0, 50, 100) |

## üì¶ Get Stock By Reference

Returns **real-time inventory** and product details for a single SKU.

Use this when you know exactly which SKU you want to check.

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Notes

- This is a **single SKU lookup**  
    If you need to fetch multiple SKUs in one request, use `POST /api/v2021/inventory`

## üì• Get Inventory

Bulk-check stock availability for **multiple SKUs at once**.

Send a list of SKU references in the body to receive their current inventory and status.

## üöö Calculate Shipping Rates

Get real-time shipping rate estimates for a given destination and list of items.

Use this endpoint to display available carriers, service levels, prices, and delivery estimates before placing an order.

### üì¶ What It Considers

Rates are calculated based on:

- Destination address (ZIP, country, region)
    
- Package weight and quantity (derived from the SKUs)
    
- Shipping carrier availability by region
    
- Priority level: Standard, Priority, Express
    

### üìå Response Includes

- `carrier`: e.g., `USPS`, `UPS`, `FedEx`
    
- `service_level`: e.g., `Ground Advantage`, `2-Day`, `Overnight`
    
- `cost`: calculated shipping charge
    
- `estimated_delivery_days`: transit time in business days
    
- `rate_id`: unique identifier used when submitting the order
    

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Tips

- Use the returned `rate_id` when submitting the actual order to lock in the rate
    
- Refresh rates if the cart or address changes

response.name: Calculate Shipping Rates
